SPEAKER: Linda
LINE: Tonight, at 11:00.

SPEAKER: Morbo
LINE: Doom!

SPEAKER: Leela
LINE: Boy, that thing's big. Fry, is my colossal eye too big?

LINE: No, it's what makes you you.

SPEAKER: Leela
LINE: But it's so round, so hideously round.

SPEAKER: Fry
LINE: Leela, listen. You're the most beautiful woman I've ever known.

LINE: Oh. So you only care about my looks?

SPEAKER: Fry
LINE: No, I.... What?

SPEAKER: Linda
LINE: Finally, New New York got a blast of class today as Nikolai, playboy ruler of the Robo-Hungarian Empire, arrived aboard his extravagant, caviar-powered yacht.

SPEAKER: Nikolai
LINE: I'm just a humble emperor, with a big, big crown!

SPEAKER: Bender
LINE: Of course I'm not planning to steal that crown!

SPEAKER: Leela
LINE: What?

SPEAKER: Bender
LINE: True. I've always dreamt of being an emperor. You know, for Halloween, and then forever. But heisting those jewels would be difficult.

LINE: You'd be stupid to try.

LINE: I'll need accomplices. A sexy vamp to distract and tie up the guard.

SPEAKER: Bender
LINE: A claw man to slip past the metal detector and cut the alarm wires.

LINE: Sorry, I'm set for life after that last job.

LINE: And finally, a chump, to be caught on video and later arrested.

SPEAKER: Fry
LINE: As I told you on Sucker-Punch Day, I'm through being a chump.

SPEAKER: Bender
LINE: Of course, it would all require split-second robotic timing. That's were I come in. You see, I own a watch.

SPEAKER: Professor Farnsworth
LINE: There. This time I'm sure I've fixed the mind-switcher.

SPEAKER: Amy
LINE: Good, I'm sick of cleaning up those heaps of dead monkeys. But why would you want your mind in a new body?

SPEAKER: Professor Farnsworth
LINE: Well, as a man enters his 18th decade, he thinks back on the mistakes he's made in life.

SPEAKER: Amy
LINE: Like the heaps of dead monkeys?

SPEAKER: Professor Farnsworth
LINE: Science cannot move forward without heaps! No, what I regret is the youth I wasted playing it safe.

SPEAKER: Amy
LINE: I wasted my youth porking out.

SPEAKER: Professor Farnsworth
LINE: Yes, I remember.

SPEAKER: Amy
LINE: Would you please take that down? It's making me hungry.

SPEAKER: Professor Farnsworth
LINE: Funny, I could use a little extra meat on my bones.  Wait a second, if we switch bodies, I could live life to the extreme, and you could indulge your demonic food lust.

SPEAKER: Amy
LINE: We are just the people this mind-switcher was made for by us!  Wait, can I still change my mind?

SPEAKER: Professor Farnsworth
LINE: Let's find out.

SPEAKER: Amy
LINE: It didn't work you doddering old

SPEAKER: Professor Farnsworth
LINE: Ah! Cartilage! Dude, I bid you a fond cowabunga! I'm off to laugh at the Reaper.  Look out, world, here I...  I'm sorry, Amy, but your body is not up to the task. Also, I don't care for these boobs flapping every which way. Now quit your bologna-gargling and let's switch back to our original bodies.

LINE: Body switcher, eh? Mayhap the heist is back on. Who needs accomplices, if I can just use their bodies.

SPEAKER: Amy
LINE: Professor, what's not happening?

SPEAKER: Professor Farnsworth
LINE: Bad news, me.  I failed to take into account the cerebral immune response.

SPEAKER: Amy
LINE: You idiot!

SPEAKER: Professor Farnsworth
LINE: Once two bodies have switched minds, they can never switch back.  However, perhaps they can. Maybe we can swap back using a third body for temporary storage space.

LINE: I'm 60% storage space.

SPEAKER: Professor Farnsworth
LINE: Eh, wha?

SPEAKER: Bender
LINE: Well, I'm off to the royal yacht for a quick seduce-and-snatch.

LINE: See ya!

SPEAKER: Professor Farnsworth
LINE: Now then, Amy, we'll simply switch bodies, and then we'll... we'll... No, I'd be back in my body, but then you and Bender would be switched. And the Amy and Bender bodies can't trade minds again, since they just did.

SPEAKER: Amy
LINE: Oh no! Is it possible to get everyone back to normal using four or more bodies?

SPEAKER: Professor Farnsworth
LINE: I'm not sure. I'm afraid we need to use... MATH.

LINE: Stupid, air-needing lungs.  The crown jewels. Now I just have to locate the guard and seduce him in...  Four seconds?

LINE: Three, two, one. Hello, big boy.

LINE: Silence! I am Basil, the emperor's cousin and chief of his royal guard. And I shall not be seduced by a...

LINE: I'm Amy. The Professor and I switched bodies.

LINE: Oh, lord.

LINE: All I wanted was to gorge myself a little, but I can't digest anything with these false teeth and this hit-or-miss colon.

LINE: If you want to save $2, we could switch bodies.

LINE: Hey, Leela. Mmm. What smells saturated?

LINE: Woah. That sounds like something Amy would say and eat.

SPEAKER: Amy

LINE: That is entirely not true, sir!

SPEAKER: Bender
LINE: Now to go switch bodies with Zoidberg, sneak past the metal detector and clip the alarm wires, all in less than...  Ten minutes ago! Oh!  Uh, could you come back when my chump gets here?

LINE: Ah, a reverse Turing test, eh? Very good. What is the square root of nine?

SPEAKER: Bender
LINE: Hold on, let me just get out a pencil.  Okay, look, I'm not that kind of robot. I'm more this kind.

SPEAKER: Professor Farnsworth
LINE: No, that won't restore everyone, either. Besides, I don't want my decrepit old body back! I'm running away with this invincible robot body and joining something!

LINE: Oh, come on!

SPEAKER: Professor Farnsworth
LINE: Good day. I am Nonchalanto, the robot daredevil. And my dream is to risk my life in strange and original ways.

LINE: That's the dumbest thing anybody's ever done. Your hired!

LINE: My fiancée, Princess Flavia. Dearest, meet Bender. He's a robot in the body of a Chinese Martian physicist.

SPEAKER: Bender
LINE: You know, we could trade bodies. I could take over the humdrum royal stuff and you could be an regular Joe for a day.  Or more. Much more.

LINE: Ew!
